body_html: Regarding 2, I'd rather use Python warnings. ATen could have a "warning callback" that would be set to a function which prints things to cerr by default, but you could change it (to e.g. emit a Python warning).
body_text: Regarding 2, I'd rather use Python warnings. ATen could have a "warning callback" that would be set to a function which prints things to cerr by default, but you could change it (to e.g. emit a Python warning).
body: Regarding 2, I'd rather use Python warnings. ATen could have a "warning callback" that would be set to a function which prints things to `cerr` by default, but you could change it (to e.g. emit a Python warning).
